member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeProfessional
member.summary: Neodynamic Barcode Professional lets you to quickly and easily generate high quality vector-based barcodes into Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) applications.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeProfessional.FNC1
member.summary: Function 1 Symbol Character (FNC1) used by GS1-128 and UCC/EAN-128 barcodes.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeProfessional.AI2

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeProfessional.AI3
member.summary: Special character used to specify that an Application Identifier (AI) is 3-digits long. Used by GS1-128 and UCC/EAN-128 barcodes.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeProfessional.AI4
member.summary: Special character used to specify that an Application Identifier (AI) is 4-digits long. Used by GS1-128 and UCC/EAN-128 barcodes.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeProfessional.AI5
member.summary: Special character used to specify that an Application Identifier (AI) is 5-digits long. Used by GS1-128 and UCC/EAN-128 barcodes.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeProfessional.GS
member.summary: Group Separator character (ASCII 29).

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeProfessional.RS
member.summary: Record Separator character (ASCII 30).

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeProfessional.EOT
member.summary: End Of Transmission character (ASCII 4).

member.summary: Saves this barcode image to the specified Stream object.
member.param: The Stream object to which to save this barcode image.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of the barcode image

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.Alignment
member.summary: Specifies the text alignment on the barcode image

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.Rotate
member.summary: Specifies the rotation angle to apply on the barcode image. It is measured clockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.Stretch
member.summary: Describes how barcode content is resized to fill its allocated space.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.Stretch.None
member.summary: The barcode content preserves size which is based on all barcode-related dimensions involved such as BarWidth, BarHeight, BarRatio, etc.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.Stretch.Fill
member.summary: The barcode content is resized to fill the destination dimensions. The aspect ratio is not preserved.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.BearerBarStyle
member.summary: Specifies the bearer bars' type that must be drawn on the barcode. Bearer bar is only available for 2 of 5, Code 128 and UCC.EAN 128 barcode symbologies.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.BearerBarStyle.None
member.summary: No bearer bars are drawn on the barcode

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.BearerBarStyle.Frame
member.summary: The bearer bars are drawn surrounding the symbol

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.BearerBarStyle.HorizontalRules
member.summary: The bearer bars are drawn at the top and bottom on the symbol

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.CodabarStartStopChar
member.summary: Specifies the start and stop character for Codabar symbology.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.Code128
member.summary: Specifies the characters set to use in the Code 128 symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.Code128.Auto
member.summary: Barcode Professional will automatically switch between code sets to encode the ASCII values.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.Code128.A
member.summary: Barcode Professional will use the Char Set A which only supports ASCII values from 0 to 95

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.Code128.B
member.summary: Barcode Professional will use the Char Set B which only supports ASCII values from 32 to 127

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.Code128.C
member.summary: Barcode Professional will use the Char Set C which only supports pairs of digits

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.FIM
member.summary: Specifies the facing identification mark (FIM) pattern to use on that symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.FIM.A
member.summary: Used for Courtesy Reply Mail (CRM) and Meter Reply Mail (MRM) with a preprinted barcode.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.FIM.B
member.summary: Used for Business Reply Mail (BRM) without a preprinted BRM ZIP+4 barcode.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.FIM.C
member.summary: Used for Business Reply Mail (BRM) with a preprinted BRM ZIP+4 barcode.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.FIM.D
member.summary: Used only with information based indicia (IBI) postage.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.TelepenEncoding
member.summary: Specifies the Telepen Encoding to use on that symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.TelepenEncoding.Ascii
member.summary: Used to encode the full range of ASCII characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.TelepenEncoding.Numeric
member.summary: Used to encode pairs of numeric characters in double-density mode.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.Supplement
member.summary: Specifies the supplement type to use with EAN and UPC symbologies.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.Pdf417CompactionType
member.summary: Specifies the Compaction Type to apply for PDF417 symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.Pdf417CompactionType.Auto
member.summary: It switches between Text, Binary and Numeric modes in order to minimize the number of codewords to be encoded.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.Pdf417CompactionType.Binary
member.summary: It allows encoding all 256 possible 8-bit byte values. This includes all ASCII characters value from 0 to 127 inclusive and provides for international character set support.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.Pdf417CompactionType.Text
member.summary: It allows encoding all printable ASCII characters, i.e. values from 32 to 126 inclusive in accordance with ISO/IEC 646, as well as selected control characters such as TAB (horizontal tab ASCII 9), LF (NL line feed, new line ASCII 10) and CR (carriage return ASCII 13).

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.Pdf417CompactionType.Numeric
member.summary: It allows encoding numeric data strings.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.Pdf417ErrorCorrection
member.summary: Specifies the Error Correction Level to apply for PDF417 symbology.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.MicroPdf417Version
member.summary: Specifies the MicroPDF417 version (a predefined combinations of numbers of columns and rows) to be generated.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.DataMatrixEncoding
member.summary: Specifies the DataMatrix Encoding to use on that symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.DataMatrixEncoding.Ascii
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains ASCII characters (0-127)

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.DataMatrixEncoding.C40
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains numeric and upper case characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.DataMatrixEncoding.Text
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains numeric and lower case characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.DataMatrixEncoding.Base256
member.summary: Used to encode 8 bit values

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.DataMatrixFormat
member.summary: Specifies the DataMatrix Format to use on that symbology.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.QRCodeEncoding
member.summary: Specifies the QR Code Encoding to use on that symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.QRCodeEncoding.Numeric
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains numeric characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.QRCodeEncoding.AlphaNumeric
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains alphanumeric characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.QRCodeEncoding.Kanji
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains Kanji characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.QRCodeEncoding.Byte
member.summary: Used to encode 8 bit values

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.QRCodeVersion
member.summary: Specifies the QR Code Version to use on that symbology. Version 1 (21 x 21 modules) to Version 40 (177 x 177 modules) increasing in steps of four modules per side.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: Specifies the Error Correction Level to apply for QR Code symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.L
member.summary: Approx. 7% of codewords can be restored. Error correction level L is appropriate for high symbol quality and/or the need for the smallest possible symbol.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.M
member.summary: Approx. 15% of codewords can be restored. Level M is described as Standard level and offers a good compromise between small size and increased reliability.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Q
member.summary: Approx. 25% of codewords can be restored. Level Q is a High reliability level and suitable for more critical or poor print quality applications.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.WPF.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.H
member.summary: Approx. 30% of codewords can be restored. Level H offers the maximum achievable reliability.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Segment Index for a Macro PDF417 symbol. Its value must be 0 (zero) up to 99998 and must be less than the value in Pdf417SegmentCount property.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeBuilder.Pdf417SegmentCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of Macro PDF417 symbols. Its value must be less than or equal to 99999.

member.summary: Gets or sets the File ID of the Macro PDF417 symbol. Its value must be a sequence of codewords (Each codeword value must be a number between 000 and 899) and must be the same for all data segments.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeBuilder.Pdf417AspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio of the height to the overall width of the PDF417 symbol. Its value must be 0 (zero) up to 1 (one).

member.summary: Gets or sets the MicroPDF417 version (a predefined combinations of numbers of columns and rows) to be generated.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeBuilder.UseQuietZoneForText
member.summary: Gets or sets whether quiet zones are used for drawing Text, Code and HumanReadableText properties.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of segments per row to be used in GS1 DataBar Expanded Stacked or RSS Expanded Stacked symbologies. It must be an even number ranging from 2 up to 22. Default is 4.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Symbol Index for a Structured Appended MaxiCode. Its value must be 1 up to 8 and must be less than the value in MaxiCodeSymbolCount property.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.BarcodeBuilder.MaxiCodeSymbolCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of MaxiCode symbols in a Structured Appended format. Its value must be less than or equal to 8.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.WPF.ImageSettings
member.summary: Defines image settings for saving barcode to raster image formats.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.ImageSettings.ImageFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the image format of the resulting image.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.ImageSettings.Dpi
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution in dots per inch (dpi) of the resulting image. The default value is 96.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.ImageSettings.PixelFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined pixel format of the resulting image. The default value is PixelFormats.Pbgra32.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.ImageSettings.Palette
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the color palette of the resulting image.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.ImageSettings.PngInterlace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the resulting Portable Network Graphics (PNG) bitmap should interlace.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.ImageSettings.JpegQualityLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the quality level of the resulting Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG) image. The quality level of the JPEG image is expressed numerically and must be between 1 and 100. 100 indicates the highest quality level, while 1 indicates the lowest. The default value is 75.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.ImageSettings.TiffCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of compression that is used by the resulting Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) image.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.ImageSettings.WmpImageQualityLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the image quality level of the resulting Microsoft Windows Media Photo (WMP) image. The range is 0 to 1.0. The default value is 0.9. A value of 1.0 represents a lossless image quality.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.ImageSettings.WmpQualityLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression quality of the resulting Microsoft Windows Media Photo (WMP) image. A value of 1 is considered lossless and higher values indicate a high compression ratio and lower image quality. The range is 0 to 255. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.WPF.ImageSettings.WmpLossless
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to encode the resulting Microsoft Windows Media Photo (WMP) image using lossless compression. The default value is false.
